How does Rosetta contribute to the desig: It performs sequence-independent folding simulations and full-atom sequence design calculations.
It predicts the tertiary structure of proteins based on primary sequences.
It identifies potential binding sites for small molecules on protein surfaces.
It simulates the dynamics of protein-ligand interactions in solution.
What challenge did the researchers encou: Strand swapping in β-sheets, indicating a need to incorporate global backbone strain considerations.
Inability to achieve high-resolution NMR spectra for validation.
Failure to generate any viable protein structures using Rosetta.
Incompatibility between designed sequences and experimental expression systems.
What is the main focus of the paper 'Rol: The importance of considering global backbone strain in the design of larger αβ-proteins.
The development of new computational algorithms for protein folding.
The discovery of new αβ-proteins in natural systems.
The analysis of protein-ligand interactions in drug design.
What potential application of the study': Informing the design of nanobodies targeting the SARS-CoV-2 spike protein.
Creating antiviral drugs that inhibit SARS-CoV-2 replication.
Engineering SARS-CoV-2 spike protein variants for research purposes.
